title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 146.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 146.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Neutral shall refer to both mediators and neutral evaluators. (b) Mediation shall refer to a
confidential dispute resolution process in which a neutral third party (the
mediator) helps parties identify issues, clarify perceptions and explore
options for a mutually acceptable outcome. (c) Neutral evaluation shall refer to a
confidential, non-binding process in which a neutral third party (the neutral
evaluator) with expertise in the subject matter relating to the dispute
provides an assessment of likely court outcomes of a case or an issue in an
effort to help parties reach a settlement. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22

146.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
